column4: I have two new filesystem mounts that only have root access. my user must have access to these mounts. How do i set that?
Access must be full
you may need to look at the chown and chmod commands.
k
excellent news.
i lied
i got more work to do
chown changes the ownership of the files.  Chmod changes the permissions.
i am not understanding what i need to do. i just need  read/write permissions for two mounted partitions.
file / folder?
I'm not really an expert with chmod, though.  If nobody steps up, you may need to google it.
k thanks man
I think it can be either.  A -R applies chmod recursively.
i found a couple good help files in google now that i know what to look for
sometimes we're better off with a hint than the actual answer.
rather
I suspect that it might be a "misprint".  The USB is probably working at full speed despite the message.
timing was 1000kb/sec roughly
rather
but when i connect my usb 2.0 thumb drive i get usb 2.0 speeds!
I'm not sure then.
ur not the only one
